common_errors.cause: Program wasn't compiled with -pg or didn't run to completion
common_errors.solution: Compile with: gcc -pg -o prog prog.c; Run program normally to generate gmon.out

common_errors.cause: gmon.out is corrupted or from incompatible gprof version
common_errors.solution: Delete gmon.out and re-run profiled program. Ensure gprof matches gcc version.

common_errors.cause: Cannot open executable or gmon.out file
common_errors.solution: Provide both executable and gmon.out: gprof ./myprogram gmon.out

common_errors.cause: Program ran too briefly for sampling, or wasn't compiled with -pg
common_errors.solution: Ensure -pg flag used in both compile and link. Run longer workload.
Use gprof matching the architecture of the profiled program.

common_errors.cause: Internal gprof error - call graph data inconsistent
common_errors.solution: Re-run profiled program to regenerate gmon.out. May be program bug or gprof bug.

common_errors.cause: Not an error - informational about sampling rate
common_errors.solution: This is status information, not an error.

common_errors.cause: Binary has basic block profiling that gprof version doesn't fully support
common_errors.solution: Use -l flag for line-by-line profiling if supported.

common_errors.cause: Executable format not recognized (may need -b flag)
common_errors.solution: Specify format: gprof -b ./program. Check executable is not stripped.

common_errors.cause: Call graph info wasn't recorded (optimization may have removed it)
